definition: nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your

sentences.english: And then there are ambitious souls looking to marry up with China’s newly well-off.
sentences.chinese: 然後指望和中國新貴結婚的野心家們出現了。

sentences.english: Hong Chengli of recreational industry parvenu discovered her artistic talent.
sentences.chinese: 娛樂業新貴洪承禮發現了她的藝術天分。

sentences.english: He had served so many high-class citizens, the rich, the governors, and the new-rich wannabes.
sentences.chinese: 他侍奉了很多上層人物，富翁，政客，和新貴們。

sentences.english: Be what lets Chen Chacheng be tea bound " parvenu " ?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼讓陳茶成爲茶界“新貴”呢？

sentences.english: A fresh richer is purchasing coffin in a store death.
sentences.chinese: 一名新貴在墓葬品商店選購他死時要用的棺材。

definition: to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
bellwether
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
made in China
not alone but in pairs (idiom, usually derog.); not a unique occurrence/it's not the only case
to bear the brunt
most outstanding/par excellence
small or medium size enterprise (SME)
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
abbr. for 紐約證券交易所|纽约证券交易所[Niu3 yue1 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
to augment/to amplify/to extend/to expand
Bank of China/abbr. for 中國銀行|中国银行[Zhong1 guo2 Yin2 hang2]
navigation/navigator/to navigate
